justifications: Before the report was released, the Pound was down -1% against several of the majors, including the US Dollar.
The US Dollar began the day on a bullish rise, as anticipation of the BoE report and subsequent speech by Mark Carney drove safe-haven demand.
Before the release, the 'Greenback' had made gains of 1.1% against the Pound.
The Pound is gradually erasing losses following the release of the Financial Stability Report, which has calmed investor fears.
Suggestions that GBP USD could hit a 34-year low today seem dovish now.
